result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey J. Woodford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eau Claire County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
**7 DAYS CREDIT IF REVOKED**
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.

Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

records.addlTxt: Judgment for unpaid fine/forfeiture/other not sent; no current address.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights with Attachment

Cases called at 10:07 AM: 22CF136, 22CF602.
Defendant Jeffrey J. Woodford in court with Attorney Alicia Linzmeier. Attorney Angela Beranek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Agreement has been reached. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
22CF136: Defendant pleads to Count 1 as charged. Sentence is Withheld and the defendant is placed on 2 Years of Probation with the following conditions:
180 Days of Jail with Huber stayed pending further order of the Court. Maintain absolute sobriety. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.  Court Costs/surcharges including one warrant fee.
22CF602: Defendant pleads. State to file Information.  Charges to be expunged upon successful completion of Probation. Defendant is granted 7 days credit. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

(Cases 22CF136, 22CF602 are 9:33 AM) Defendant Jeffrey J. Woodford not in court.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Jeffrey J. Woodford. Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has had contact recently and requests new date. 
Arraignment in 22CF136 & Initial Appearance in 22CF306: 07/22/2022 at 9:12 AM.

9:43 AM Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffrey J. Woodford in court. Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Jeffrey J. Woodford. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Refer to Br. 4 for scheduling arraignment.

(Case called at 11:18 am.)  Court Commissioner Matthew Krische appeared for Branch 3
Defendant Jeffrey Woodford appeared with Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in person.  State by DDA Angela Beranek 
Warrant Quashed.  Bond reinstated.
Pretrial Conference:  04-18-22 at 2 pm.   Hearing:  05-02-22 at 9:30 am.

9:49 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jeffrey J. Woodford not in court, Attorney Alicia Linzmeier for Jeffrey J. Woodford appeared in court. Defense has no information to provide to the court. State requests a warrant- so ordered.
